greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest k <= sigma(n)-A007947(n) such that n-k and n-(sigma(n)-k) are relatively prime.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: A325972(n) = { my(s=sigma(n)); forstep(i=s-A007947(n), 0, -1, if(1==gcd(n-i, n-(s-i)), return(i))); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 31 2019
